title: Drawing, "Design for a Chinese Pavilion", 1815–22
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Horizontal rectangle. A large structure, with columns as supports on the section visible. The building is divided into three sections, each roofed separately: two enclosed wings and a central open porch. The structure is on a terrace, with ramps and stairways leading to it. Stairs right.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Chinese Pavilion", 1815–22.
1815–22. Watercolor on paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-79.
